You stride up the gangplank to find the crew dancing merrily to the tune of a flute. ‘Ah, shkipper, jush tryin’ to keep the crew trit ‘n’ fim,’ slurs the bo’sun as he hastily conceals a bottle of grog. You shake your head despairingly and go aft to your cabin. Maybe you should hire better crewmen?
Go back into town Walk along the harbourfront Set sail
